questions.question_chart_svg: <svg width='400' height='300' viewBox='0 0 400 300' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect width='400' height='300' fill='white' /><line x1='50' y1='250' x2='350' y2='250' style='stroke:black;stroke-width:2' /><line x1='50' y1='250' x2='50' y2='50' style='stroke:black;stroke-width:2' /><text x='360' y='250' font-size='12'>x</text><text x='30' y='40' font-size='12'>y</text><circle cx='100' cy='200' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='150' cy='150' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='200' cy='100' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='250' cy='50' r='3' fill='black' /><line x1='75' y1='225' x2='275' y2='25' style='stroke:blue;stroke-width:2' /></svg>
questions.question_chart_description: Scatterplot showing a negative linear relationship with four data points and a line of best fit.
questions.question: The scatterplot shows the relationship between two variables, x and y. A line of best fit is also shown. Which of the following equations best represents the line of best fit?
questions.explanation: The line of best fit has a negative slope and intersects the y-axis at approximately 15. Thus, the equation is y = -x + 15.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Identify the slope direction and y-intercept from the graph to select the correct line equation.

questions.question_chart_svg: <svg width='400' height='300' viewBox='0 0 400 300' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect width='400' height='300' fill='white' /><line x1='50' y1='250' x2='350' y2='250' style='stroke:black;stroke-width:2' /><line x1='50' y1='250' x2='50' y2='50' style='stroke:black;stroke-width:2' /><text x='360' y='250' font-size='12'>Time (hours)</text><text x='30' y='40' font-size='12'>Distance (miles)</text><circle cx='100' cy='220' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='150' cy='190' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='200' cy='160' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='250' cy='130' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='300' cy='100' r='3' fill='black' /><line x1='75' y1='235' x2='325' y2='85' style='stroke:blue;stroke-width:2' /></svg>
questions.question_chart_description: Scatterplot of distance versus time with a decreasing trend and line of best fit.
questions.question: The scatterplot shows the remaining distance to a destination over time during a trip. What does the line of best fit predict for the remaining distance after 4 hours?
questions.explanation: The line passes through approximately (4,30) on the graph.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Extend the line of best fit to predict values at specific points on the x-axis.

questions.question_chart_svg: <svg width='400' height='300' viewBox='0 0 400 300' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect width='400' height='300' fill='white' /><line x1='50' y1='250' x2='350' y2='250' style='stroke:black;stroke-width:2' /><line x1='50' y1='250' x2='50' y2='50' style='stroke:black;stroke-width:2' /><text x='360' y='250' font-size='12'>x</text><text x='30' y='40' font-size='12'>y</text><circle cx='100' cy='100' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='150' cy='150' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='200' cy='200' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='250' cy='250' r='3' fill='black' /><path d='M75 75 Q200 300 325 75' style='stroke:black;stroke-width:2;fill:none' /></svg>
questions.question_chart_description: Scatterplot with four points suggesting a quadratic model.
questions.question: Of the following, which is the best model for the data in the scatterplot?
questions.explanation: The data forms a downward-opening parabola with vertex around (5,25).
questions.score_improvement_tip: Determine the shape and orientation of the curve to choose the appropriate quadratic model.

questions.question_chart_svg: <svg width='400' height='300' viewBox='0 0 400 300' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect width='400' height='300' fill='white' /><line x1='50' y1='250' x2='350' y2='250' style='stroke:black;stroke-width:2' /><line x1='50' y1='250' x2='50' y2='50' style='stroke:black;stroke-width:2' /><text x='360' y='250' font-size='12'>Time (min)</text><text x='30' y='40' font-size='12'>Height (cm)</text><circle cx='100' cy='200' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='150' cy='170' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='200' cy='140' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='250' cy='110' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='300' cy='80' r='3' fill='black' /></svg>
questions.question_chart_description: Scatterplot of plant height over time with a linear decreasing trend.
questions.question: The graph shows the height of a candle as it burns over time. What is the average rate of change in height, in centimeters per minute, from 10 minutes to 30 minutes? Enter your answer as a decimal.
questions.explanation: At 10 min, height ≈ 18 cm; at 30 min, height ≈ 12 cm. Change = 12 - 18 = -6 cm over 20 min, rate = -6/20 = -0.3 cm/min.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Calculate average rate of change by finding the difference in y-values over the difference in x-values.

questions.question_chart_svg: <svg width='400' height='300' viewBox='0 0 400 300' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect width='400' height='300' fill='white' /><line x1='50' y1='250' x2='350' y2='250' style='stroke:black;stroke-width:2' /><line x1='50' y1='250' x2='50' y2='50' style='stroke:black;stroke-width:2' /><text x='360' y='250' font-size='12'>x</text><text x='30' y='40' font-size='12'>y</text><circle cx='80' cy='240' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='120' cy='200' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='160' cy='160' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='200' cy='120' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='240' cy='80' r='3' fill='black' /><line x1='60' y1='260' x2='260' y2='60' style='stroke:blue;stroke-width:2' /></svg>
questions.question_chart_description: Scatterplot with negative linear correlation and line of best fit.
questions.question: The scatterplot shows the relationship between x and y. Which of the following is closest to the slope of the line of best fit?
questions.explanation: Using points (2,24) and (6,12), slope = (12-24)/(6-2) = -12/4 = -3, but adjusted for best fit ≈ -1.2.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Approximate the slope using two points on the line of best fit.

questions.question_chart_svg: <svg width='400' height='300' viewBox='0 0 400 300' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect width='400' height='300' fill='white' /><line x1='50' y1='250' x2='350' y2='250' style='stroke:black;stroke-width:2' /><line x1='50' y1='250' x2='50' y2='50' style='stroke:black;stroke-width:2' /><text x='360' y='250' font-size='12'>x</text><text x='30' y='40' font-size='12'>y</text><circle cx='100' cy='220' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='150' cy='180' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='200' cy='140' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='250' cy='100' r='3' fill='black' /><line x1='75' y1='240' x2='275' y2='80' style='stroke:blue;stroke-width:2' /></svg>
questions.question_chart_description: Scatterplot showing linear relationship with line of best fit.
questions.question: The scatterplot shows the relationship between two variables, x and y. A line of best fit for the data is also shown. Which of the following is closest to the difference between the y-coordinate of the data point with x = 3 and the y-value predicted by the line of best fit at x = 3?
questions.explanation: Data point at x=3 has y=16, predicted ≈13, difference=3.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Find residuals by subtracting predicted from actual y-values.

questions.question_chart_svg: <svg width='400' height='300' viewBox='0 0 400 300' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect width='400' height='300' fill='white' /><line x1='50' y1='250' x2='350' y2='250' style='stroke:black;stroke-width:2' /><line x1='50' y1='250' x2='50' y2='50' style='stroke:black;stroke-width:2' /><text x='360' y='250' font-size='12'>Time (s)</text><text x='30' y='40' font-size='12'>Velocity (m/s)</text><circle cx='100' cy='240' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='150' cy='200' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='200' cy='160' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='250' cy='120' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='300' cy='80' r='3' fill='black' /></svg>
questions.question_chart_description: Graph of velocity over time for an object.
questions.question: The graph shows the velocity v, in meters per second, of an object t seconds after it started moving, for 0 ≤ t ≤ 10. What is the average rate of change, in meters per second per second, in the velocity from t = 2 to t = 6?
questions.score_improvement_tip: Average rate of change is the slope between two points on the graph.

questions.question_chart_svg: <svg width='400' height='300' viewBox='0 0 400 300' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect width='400' height='300' fill='white' /><line x1='50' y1='250' x2='350' y2='250' style='stroke:black;stroke-width:2' /><line x1='50' y1='250' x2='50' y2='50' style='stroke:black;stroke-width:2' /><text x='360' y='250' font-size='12'>Year</text><text x='30' y='40' font-size='12'>Sales (thousands)</text><circle cx='100' cy='220' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='150' cy='180' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='200' cy='140' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='250' cy='100' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='300' cy='60' r='3' fill='black' /><line x1='75' y1='240' x2='325' y2='40' style='stroke:blue;stroke-width:2' /></svg>
questions.question_chart_description: Scatterplot of sales over years with line of best fit.
questions.question: The scatterplot above shows company sales every 5 years from 2000 to 2020. A line of best fit is shown, and its equation is <math><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>8</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>160</mn></math>. What does the line of best fit predict about the decrease in sales over the 20-year period?

options.A: Each year, the average decrease was 8 thousand.
options.B: Each year, the average decrease was 160 thousand.
options.C: Every 5 years, the average decrease was 8 thousand.
options.D: Every 5 years, the average decrease was 160 thousand.

questions.explanation: The slope -8 indicates an average decrease of 8 thousand per year.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Interpret the slope as the rate of change per unit on the x-axis.

questions.question_chart_svg: <svg width='400' height='300' viewBox='0 0 400 300' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect width='400' height='300' fill='white' /><line x1='50' y1='250' x2='350' y2='250' style='stroke:black;stroke-width:2' /><line x1='50' y1='250' x2='50' y2='50' style='stroke:black;stroke-width:2' /><text x='360' y='250' font-size='12'>Time (min)</text><text x='30' y='40' font-size='12'>Temperature (°C)</text><circle cx='100' cy='50' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='150' cy='100' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='200' cy='150' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='250' cy='200' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='300' cy='250' r='3' fill='black' /></svg>
questions.question_chart_description: Graph showing increasing temperature over time.
questions.question: In an experiment, a sample is heated, and the temperature is recorded every minute. The graph above shows the temperature in degrees Celsius. During which 1-minute interval does the temperature increase at the greatest average rate?
questions.explanation: The steepest segment is at the beginning, indicating greatest rate.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Compare slopes of segments to find the greatest rate of change.

questions.question_chart_svg: <svg width='400' height='300' viewBox='0 0 400 300' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect width='400' height='300' fill='white' /><line x1='50' y1='250' x2='350' y2='250' style='stroke:black;stroke-width:2' /><line x1='50' y1='250' x2='50' y2='50' style='stroke:black;stroke-width:2' /><text x='360' y='250' font-size='12'>x</text><text x='30' y='40' font-size='12'>y</text><circle cx='100' cy='250' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='150' cy='200' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='200' cy='150' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='250' cy='100' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='300' cy='50' r='3' fill='black' /><line x1='75' y1='275' x2='325' y2='25' style='stroke:blue;stroke-width:2' /></svg>
questions.question_chart_description: Scatterplot with data points and line of best fit.
questions.question: What is the y-value predicted by the line of best fit when x = 5?
questions.explanation: The line suggests y decreases by 10 for every 1 increase in x, from intercept 60, at x=5 y=10.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Use the line to interpolate or extrapolate predicted values.

questions.question_chart_svg: <svg width='400' height='300' viewBox='0 0 400 300' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect width='400' height='300' fill='white' /><line x1='50' y1='250' x2='350' y2='250' style='stroke:black;stroke-width:2' /><line x1='50' y1='250' x2='50' y2='50' style='stroke:black;stroke-width:2' /><text x='360' y='250' font-size='12'>x</text><text x='30' y='40' font-size='12'>y</text><circle cx='100' cy='50' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='150' cy='100' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='200' cy='150' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='250' cy='200' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='300' cy='250' r='3' fill='black' /><line x1='75' y1='25' x2='325' y2='275' style='stroke:blue;stroke-width:2' /></svg>
questions.question_chart_description: Scatterplot for data set A with line of best fit.
questions.question: The scatterplot shows the relationship between two variables, x and y, for data set A. A line of best fit is shown. Data set B is created by adding 5 to the y-coordinate of each data point from data set A. Which of the following could be an equation of a line of best fit for data set B?
questions.explanation: Adding 5 to each y shifts the intercept up by 5, slope remains 1.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Transformations on data points affect the intercept or slope accordingly.

questions.question_chart_svg: <svg width='400' height='300' viewBox='0 0 400 300' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect width='400' height='300' fill='white' /><line x1='50' y1='250' x2='350' y2='250' style='stroke:black;stroke-width:2' /><line x1='50' y1='250' x2='50' y2='50' style='stroke:black;stroke-width:2' /><text x='360' y='250' font-size='12'>x</text><text x='30' y='40' font-size='12'>y</text><circle cx='100' cy='240' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='120' cy='220' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='140' cy='200' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='160' cy='180' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='180' cy='160' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='200' cy='140' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='220' cy='120' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='240' cy='100' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='260' cy='80' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='280' cy='60' r='3' fill='black' /><path d='M50 250 Q150 50 350 250' style='stroke:black;stroke-width:2;fill:none' /></svg>
questions.question: The scatterplot shows the relationship between two variables, x and y. An equation for the model shown can be written as <math><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>a</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mi>h</mi><mo>)</mo><msup><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mi>k</mi></math>, where a, h, and k are constants. Which of the following is true about a?
questions.explanation: The parabola opens downward, so a < 0.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Determine the sign of a from the direction the parabola opens.

questions.question_chart_svg: <svg width='400' height='300' viewBox='0 0 400 300' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect width='400' height='300' fill='white' /><line x1='50' y1='250' x2='350' y2='250' style='stroke:black;stroke-width:2' /><line x1='50' y1='250' x2='50' y2='50' style='stroke:black;stroke-width:2' /><text x='360' y='250' font-size='12'>x</text><text x='30' y='40' font-size='12'>y</text><circle cx='100' cy='250' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='150' cy='200' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='200' cy='150' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='250' cy='100' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='300' cy='50' r='3' fill='black' /></svg>
questions.question_chart_description: Scatterplot of data with exponential decay.
questions.question: The scatterplot shows the relationship between two variables, x and y. An equation for the exponential model shown can be written as <math><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>a</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>b</mi><mo>)</mo><msup><mi>x</mi></msup></math>, where a and b are positive constants. What is the value of b, rounded to the nearest hundredth?
questions.explanation: From points, y halves every 2 units in x, so b = (1/2)^(1/2) ≈ 0.71, but adjusted ≈0.75.
questions.score_improvement_tip: For exponential models, find b using ratios of y-values.

questions.question_chart_svg: <svg width='400' height='300' viewBox='0 0 400 300' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect width='400' height='300' fill='white' /><line x1='50' y1='250' x2='350' y2='250' style='stroke:black;stroke-width:2' /><line x1='50' y1='250' x2='50' y2='50' style='stroke:black;stroke-width:2' /><text x='360' y='250' font-size='12'>x</text><text x='30' y='40' font-size='12'>y</text><circle cx='100' cy='100' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='150' cy='120' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='200' cy='140' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='250' cy='160' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='300' cy='180' r='3' fill='black' /><line x1='75' y1='90' x2='325' y2='190' style='stroke:blue;stroke-width:2' /></svg>
questions.question_chart_description: Scatterplot for original data with line.
questions.question: The scatterplot shows data set C with a line of best fit. Data set D is created by multiplying each x-coordinate by 2. Which equation could be the line of best fit for D?
questions.explanation: Doubling x halves the slope.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Scaling x affects the slope inversely.

questions.question_chart_svg: <svg width='400' height='300' viewBox='0 0 400 300' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect width='400' height='300' fill='white' /><line x1='50' y1='250' x2='350' y2='250' style='stroke:black;stroke-width:2' /><line x1='50' y1='250' x2='50' y2='50' style='stroke:black;stroke-width:2' /><text x='360' y='250' font-size='12'>x</text><text x='30' y='40' font-size='12'>y</text><circle cx='100' cy='250' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='120' cy='230' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='140' cy='210' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='160' cy='190' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='180' cy='170' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='200' cy='150' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='220' cy='130' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='240' cy='110' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='260' cy='90' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='280' cy='70' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='300' cy='50' r='3' fill='black' /><path d='M50 250 L350 50' style='stroke:black;stroke-width:2;fill:none' /></svg>
questions.question_chart_description: Scatterplot with points close to a line.
questions.question: The scatterplot shows the relationship between x and y. If the line of best fit is <math><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>30</mn></math>, what is the residual for the point where x=10?
questions.explanation: Predicted y=20, actual ≈18, residual=-2.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Residuals measure fit; calculate as actual minus predicted.

questions.question_chart_svg: <svg width='400' height='300' viewBox='0 0 400 300' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect width='400' height='300' fill='white' /><line x1='50' y1='250' x2='350' y2='250' style='stroke:black;stroke-width:2' /><line x1='50' y1='250' x2='50' y2='50' style='stroke:black;stroke-width:2' /><text x='360' y='250' font-size='12'>x</text><text x='30' y='40' font-size='12'>y</text><circle cx='100' cy='50' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='150' cy='100' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='200' cy='150' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='250' cy='200' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='300' cy='250' r='3' fill='black' /></svg>
questions.question: The line of best fit for the data is <math><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>50</mn></math>. If a new data set is created by subtracting 10 from each y-value, what is the new slope?
questions.explanation: Subtracting constant from y doesn't change slope.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Vertical shifts don't affect slope.

questions.question_chart_svg: <svg width='400' height='300' viewBox='0 0 400 300' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect width='400' height='300' fill='white' /><line x1='50' y1='250' x2='350' y2='250' style='stroke:black;stroke-width:2' /><line x1='50' y1='250' x2='50' y2='50' style='stroke:black;stroke-width:2' /><text x='360' y='250' font-size='12'>x</text><text x='30' y='40' font-size='12'>y</text><circle cx='100' cy='250' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='130' cy='220' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='160' cy='190' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='190' cy='160' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='220' cy='130' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='250' cy='100' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='280' cy='70' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='310' cy='40' r='3' fill='black' /><path d='M50 250 Q200 100 350 250' style='stroke:black;stroke-width:2;fill:none' /></svg>
questions.question: Which transformation would linearize the data?
questions.explanation: Quadratic relationship suggests plotting against x^2 for linearity.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Choose transformations based on the curve shape to achieve linearity.

questions.question: A data set has a line of best fit y = 2x + 3. If each x-value is increased by 4 and each y-value decreased by 6, what is the new line of best fit?
questions.score_improvement_tip: Adjust for shifts in both variables when transforming data.

questions.question_chart_svg: <svg width='400' height='300' viewBox='0 0 400 300' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect width='400' height='300' fill='white' /><line x1='50' y1='250' x2='350' y2='250' style='stroke:black;stroke-width:2' /><line x1='50' y1='250' x2='50' y2='50' style='stroke:black;stroke-width:2' /><text x='360' y='250' font-size='12'>x</text><text x='30' y='40' font-size='12'>y</text><circle cx='100' cy='250' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='150' cy='200' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='200' cy='150' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='250' cy='100' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='300' cy='50' r='3' fill='black' /></svg>
questions.question: For the exponential model <math><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>100</mn><mo>(</mo><mn>0.8</mn><mo>)</mo><msup><mi>x</mi></msup></math>, what is the predicted y when x=5?
questions.score_improvement_tip: Calculate exponential values step by step for accuracy.

questions.question_chart_svg: <svg width='400' height='300' viewBox='0 0 400 300' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect width='400' height='300' fill='white' /><line x1='50' y1='250' x2='350' y2='250' style='stroke:black;stroke-width:2' /><line x1='50' y1='250' x2='50' y2='50' style='stroke:black;stroke-width:2' /><text x='360' y='250' font-size='12'>x</text><text x='30' y='40' font-size='12'>y</text><circle cx='100' cy='50' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='150' cy='100' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='200' cy='150' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='250' cy='200' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='300' cy='250' r='3' fill='black' /><line x1='75' y1='25' x2='325' y2='275' style='stroke:blue;stroke-width:2' /></svg>
questions.question: If the data is fit with <math><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>m</mi><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>b</mi></math>, and then a new set multiplies y by -1, what is the new slope?
questions.explanation: Multiplying y by -1 negates the slope.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Scaling y scales the slope by the same factor.
